name: Jugs, Ewers, and  Buckets
description:
### Background

Sensei [Giacomo](http://www.codewars.com/users/GiacomoSorbi) likes to drink lots of water to keep himself well hydrated and his brain functioning at peak performance!  But he likes to measure out exactly how much water he drinks in a day.

He has many different water vessels in his dojo, but very limited time to fill them up, so he needs some help with planning and filling one of his many jugs with the exact amount of water he wants to drink in a day.

Strangely the sensei likes to know that the puzzle has a solution, but then he likes to solve the puzzle himself!

### Rules

Each container can either:

* Be filled from any other container until either the first is empty or the second is full.
* Be filled until full from the tap in his kitchen.

Dumping the contents of any container is **not** allowed, that would waste water, and Sensi Giacomo cannot condone waste!

### Example

If Sensei Giacamo decided he needed to drink 11 litres of water today, and he found he had containers for 2, 3, 7, and 19 litres available, he'd like to know the minimum number moves it would take to get exactly 11 litres of water in one of his containers.

In this case it is possible:

           | Containers |
    Move   |  2 3 7 19  | Notes
    ------------------------------------------------
    Step 1 |  2 0 0  0  | Fill 2L
    Step 2 |  2 0 0 19  | Fill 19L
    Step 3 |  0 2 0 19  | Move all from 2L into 3L
    Step 4 |  0 3 0 18  | Move 1L from 19L to 3L
    Step 5 |  0 3 7 11  | Move 7L from 19L into 7L
    
This sequence of five moves leaves 11L of water in the 19L container as required.    

### Kata

You must aid Sensei Giacomo by completing the method `how_many_moves`, you are given a sequence containing the sizes of the water carriers, the number of litres required, and the maximum number of moves Giacomo is prepared to make that day.

If it possible to solve the problem in the number of moves available, then return the number of moves required, `5` in the above example.  If it is not possible, then return `-1`.

#### Code example:
```python
how_many_moves([2, 3, 7, 19], 11, 5) # => 5
how_many_moves([2, 3, 7, 19], 11, 4) # => -1
```
